title.narrative: Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in East Central Uganda (RHITES-EC)

description.narrative: (Uganda): RHITES-EC supports implementation of integrated maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH), family planning (FP), malaria, HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis (TB), nutrition, and water, hygiene, and sanitation (WASH) interventions in 12 districts serving a population of approximately four million people. With $6,008,591 million in FY 2020 funds, four areas will be prioritized: scaling up and advancing quality high-impact interventions; strengthening community-level interventions to increase uptake of services; strengthening health systems to improve the delivery of services, and strengthening data systems, data quality, and utilization. Major activities include: strengthening district coordination and management of health investments and outcomes pertaining to service delivery, increasing coverage through integrated community outreach, and strengthening supply chain management..To ensure continuation of services during the COVID-19 pandemic, RHITES-EC will align interventions with Ugandan Ministry of Health guidance. This will integrate infection prevention and control activities and support targeted provision of personal protective equipment to protect service providers and beneficiaries of MNCH, FP, TB, and nutrition services. .RHITES-EC will support communities to identify and address structural, social, and patient-related barriers to seeking health care. The activity will support district coordination mechanisms and stakeholder platforms to enhance resource allocation and advocacy to improve MNCH and FP services. .RHITES-EC will contribute to the Mission's Journey to Self-Reliance vision through meaningful engagements with all stakeholders and beneficiaries to identify, plan, and implement local solutions to health challenges, promoting commitment, and capacity to provide quality health services...
